clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Distress in Crisis Situations During COVID-19
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Distress in Crisis Situations During COVID-19

brief_summary.textblock:
There are many scales for screening or assessing the impact of a disease. These scales are
      generally used to diagnose or assess the severity of a disease and are carried out at the
      request of a physician by the patient. Conversational agents could make it possible to
      administer these questionnaires remotely, analyse them and use the results on a large scale,
      without prior medical intervention.

      The main objective of this study is to quantify and qualify the distress of a large
      population in times of pandemic crisis.

detailed_description.textblock:
The Peritraumatic Distress Inventory is the standard tool designed to assess distress in
      times of crisis. It consists of 13 questions.

      Questions will be submitted to the participants from the Vik chatbot. Responses will be
      analysed and compared according to the demographics and pathologies encountered.

primary_outcome.measure: quantify and qualify distress over a large population in times of pandemic crisis.

secondary_outcome.measure: qualify demographic data vs distress over a large population in times of pandemic crisis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Age > 18 years old

               -  Collection of the subject's non-opposition

               -  Patient registration on Vik breast, Vik asthma, Vik migraine, Vik depression

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patient unable to formulate non-opposition
